New Records: Lockie Ferguson bowled four maidens to return the format's most economical figures, taking 3/0 against Papua New Guinea.
This is the second time in men's T20 Internationals that a bowler has bowled a full four overs without conceding a run.
Key Match Events: Lockie Ferguson took 3 wickets for 0 runs in his four-over spell.
New Zealand bowled out Papua New Guinea for 78 in 19.4 overs.
Devon Conway scored 35 from 32 balls to help New Zealand chase the target.
Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell finished the chase with 46 balls to spare.
Tim Southee dismissed Tony Ura for 1(2) in the second over.
Trent Boult took 2/15 in his last T20 World Cup appearance.
Mitchell Santner took 1/17 from four overs.
Kabua Morea took 2/4 in his 2.2 overs for Papua New Guinea.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Trent Boult made his last appearance at a T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand ended their tournament with a comfortable win over Papua New Guinea.
New Zealand's losses to Afghanistan and West Indies ended their campaign early, a disappointing outcome for a side ranked fifth in the world.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delayed the start of play.
Both New Zealand and Papua New Guinea were playing their final match at the tournament after missing out on qualification from Group C.
